abstract: Nokia enters the netbook PC market with the Booklet 3G. In addition to 3G data connectivity, the machine boasts a 12-hour battery life — much longer than the competition.
snippet: Nokia enters the netbook PC market with the Booklet 3G. In addition to 3G data connectivity, the machine boasts a 12-hour battery life — much longer than the competition.
lead_paragraph: Nokia is entering the personal computer market with a small netbook computer, the Booklet 3G, which has specifications much like a cellphone: 3G, Bluetooth, GPS, and a headphone and microphone combined on one jack. It’s also got a price that gets a lot better if you sign up for a two-year contract for wireless data on AT&T: $299. (It costs $599 without the $60-a-month commitment.)

headline.main: Nokia’s Netbook Comes With Marathon Battery Life
